title: Teddy Tun Win HLA
text:
Hi :)
I am Teddy.

I am an intensive care medicine specialist registrar in London.
I also work as a senior clinial data scientist at London AI centre
I have a special interest in data science, machine learning and using data driven approaches to draw insights on patient‚Äôs physiology and clinical outcomes.
Clinically, I am interested in the use of extra-corporeal membrane oxygenation therapy (ECMO) in various critical illness settings.
Get in touch!

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
section: This is a talk about version control
text:
This is a talk about version control

General outline: 1. Introduce the problem. Make it familiar and relatable. - Documentation focused collaboration in the NHS is fragmented and broken 2. Demonstrate a solution by using: Plain text (Markdown), git and github. 3. Tackle obvious criticisms: - We already have version control/track changes in word. Yes, but you haven‚Äôt solved the emailing files issue - So use google docs. This isn‚Äôt a realistic solution and many trusts will not accept working closely with google as a company. 4. Show the benefits beyond simple ‚Äútrack changes‚Äù. - Multi-institute collaborations - Enhanced productivity - Re-visiting old branches/toughts - Total audit trail of peer review 5. Practical steps (How to get started? Where to go?) - Learn the tools: Markdown (already know some of this from whatsapp etc.), Git (this is a little code orientated, but there is software to help), Github. - Read the Turing Way - Speak to your IT department. Run a pilot 6. Contribute back - If you get this working write a chapter for healthcare collaboration in the turing way.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
section: This is a talk about version control collaboration
text: This is a talk about version control collaboration

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
The Problem


Document collaboration in the NHS is broken.
Lowest common demonimator; MS Word and email.
guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol is a symptom.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Frustrating Examples


Colleague returns tracked changes on version 3. We‚Äôre now on version 5.
Trust only pays for word licences on certain PCs.
Collaborator changes all the formatting and resized the figures.




Solutions: cloud (MS word üí∞ / google üòà).
Neither scales well.
There are industries that have solved scalable document collaboration.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text: Game development: dozen or hundreds of developers often writing in different countries Ultimately these are just plane text files

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Assassin‚Äôs Creed

34 million players by October 2023
Ubisoft game studio
2000 developers

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text: Major international research collaborations: CERN: Thousands of authors from multiple continents.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text: Linux: Powers the internet and the vast majority of the phones in this room Created the very tools we will discuss today to solve this issue

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Introduce the turing way. A decentralised group to bring these methods and technologies into the hands of scientists.


2

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
A (somewhat meta) Example

Teddy and I are writing this presentation
We don‚Äôt use powerpoint; plain text!

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
The Power of Plain Text


Writing text without any formatting = efficiency.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Collaboration

Each collaborator / idea lives in seperate branches.
Merged when ready.
Version controlled: implicit to the method of collaboration.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Untapped Potential

Imagine every NHS trust uses this approach
we need a new hyponatraemia guidelines
St.¬†Elshwere; global reputation
Find their guidelines on github: Fork



We do this already informally

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Untapped Potential

Major new RCT changes practice.
St.¬†Elsewhere updates their guidelines.
We are notified.
The change is ratified and instantly disseminated.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Advantages/Benefits

Practical: time saved, better collaboration, transparanecy
Future proof
Scalable

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Challenges

Some technical knowhow necessary.
Buy in: change in the way we work.
Some friction now, for a massive payoff later. Start early (?undergrad ?A levels)
Network effects are multiplicative.
Level of trust comfort: documents in public domain.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Questions

Why would we want to have guidelines in plain text?
Formatting/branding? Develop trust templates.
Webpage as output: high fidelity medium, video, audio, reactive.

title: guideline-version3-finalcomments49corrected.docx.lol
text:
Credits




Community, The Turing Way. 2021. ‚ÄúThe Turing Way: A Handbook for Reproducible, Ethical and Collaborative Research.‚Äù Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/ZENODO.5671094.

title: My CV
text:
Current roles

Health Education England Intensive Care Medicine Specialist Registrar in London
Senior Clinical Data Scientist at London AI centre
European Society of Intensive Care Medicine Social Media and Communications Committee Member



Skills

Clinical

Extra corporeal membrane oxygenation
Critical care transfer and retrieval
Experience as clinician in critical illness, multi-organ support, mechanical ventilation, burns, haematological and oncological, and general intensive care units.

Data science

development of reproducible data analysis pipelines using SQL, R, Python
Structured and unstructured data analaysis and development of machine learning models
Fully stack capabilities from ETL to complex statistical and machine leearning model and serving through interactive online web applications using Shiny, Streamlit.
Produce production-ready code using MLOps best practices and version control.

Leadership and Management

Competency and experience in managing high performing, dynamic teams in high pressure environments.
Experience in successfully leading an end-to-end data process of data science life cycle from conception to completion in academic, clinical and private sectors using reproducible and open-source tools
Effective communication with patients, multi-disciplinary teams
Communicating with technical and non-technical audiences using peer-reviewed scientific publications, academic posters, presentations, real-time dynamic apps using Shiny, Quarto, Streamlit
